resources.string: Alerts you if you need to start the app. Should be high priority.
Pops up when someone sends you a payment and you need to accept it manually.
Notifies you that Phoenix is running in background. This happens when someone is sending you money and the app is not already started.
Do not import a seed that was NOT created by this application.\n\nAlso, make sure you are not already running another Phoenix wallet with the same seed.
Your wallet\'s seed is a list of 12 English words
This is not a valid word.
This seed is not valid.\nMake sure you entered the words\nin the correct order.

Phoenix is locked.\nPlease authenticate to continue.
The application could not start.\n\nError details: %1$s
The application could not start. The address of the custom Electrum server is not valid.\n\nGo to Settings > Electrum to fix your settings.
The Tor service could not start. Check that your connection is working and try again.\n\nError details: %1$s
The wallet key could not be read.\n\nPlease restart the application or contact support.
Your internet connection is not working. Please check your WiFi or cellular network.
Enroll a fingerprint in Android first to unlock the wallet.\n\nOtherwise, restore your wallet using your 12-words seed backup.
There was an error when generating the invoice (%1$s).\n\nPlease try again.
Your wallet is empty. First payment you receive must be at least %1$s.
The amount and the description of an invoice are optional and can be edited.
This invoice will have no description
Could not retrieve a Bitcoin address from the swap service.\n\nTry again later.

Funds sent to this address will show on Phoenix after one confirmation.

A %1$s%% fee will be applied.

In order to receive payments on Lightning, you need to have a channel with enough inbound liquidity.\n\nIf you don\'t have one, Phoenix will automatically create a channel on-the-fly as needed. The setup fee covers the cost of creating the channel and allocating liquidity to it.
You have a pending incoming payment of
Accepting this payment requires a setup fee of %1$s (%2$s).
This is not a valid amount.
Cannot pay more than 2 times the requested amount.
This amount is below the requested amount.
On-chain transactions are typically slower and best suited for large payments.
Lightning payments are fast and best suited for small payments.
Total after fees exceeds your balance.\nThis payment cannot be sent.
Payments to on-chain addresses require a swap and incur mining fees for the Bitcoin network. The fee rate used for the transaction is fixed by the swap service.
Scan a QR code containing a payment request, a Bitcoin address or a LNURL
This payment does not use the same blockchain as your wallet.
Failed to process this LNUrl link. Make sure it is valid.
The LNUrl service returned an error.
This type of LNUrl is not supported yet!
This data uses an unknown format and cannot be processed.

This invoice doesn\'t include an amount. This may be dangerous: malicious nodes may be able to steal your payment. To be safe, you should ask the payee to specify an amount in the payment request.\n\nAre you sure you want to pay this invoice?
Open a link in a browser
This field must be an integer
A cheating attempt has been detected.
The background watcher needs internet to function properly.
A pending payment has been fulfilled
Use this screen to close your payments channels and drain your funds to a Bitcoin address.
You have %1$d active Lightning channel(s) holding an aggregated balance of %2$s. Closing those channels will send funds to the provided Bitcoin address.\n\nMake sure that this address is correct.
You currently don\'t have any channels that could be closed.

Force close allows you to unilaterally close your channels.

This feature is not a "fix everything magic button"; it is here as a safety measure and should only be used in extreme scenarii. For example, if your peer (ACINQ) disappears permanently, preventing you from spending your money. In all other cases, if you experience issues with Phoenix you should contact support.

Force closing channels will cost you money (to cover the on-chain fees) and will cause your funds to be locked for days. Do not uninstall the app until your channels are fully closed or you will lose money.

Do not use this feature if you don\'t fully understand what it does.
Funds will eventually be sent to:
This address is derived from your seed and belongs to you.
Are you sure you want to proceed?
There was a problem. Please try again later.
%1$d channel(s) have been closed. You can find the details in the home screen.
You don\'t have any channels yet.\n\nPayments channels are created automatically when needed to receive payments.
Could not retrieve the details for this channel. Please try again later.
Thanks for using Phoenix. Please backup your wallet so that you don\'t lose your bitcoins.
Phoenix needs to be able to run in background from time to time. Make sure your device does not aggressively kill this app for battery savings.
An update for this app is available.
A critical update is available. The wallet may malfunction if not updated.
Bitcoin mempool is full and fees are high.
Could not unlock seed, please try again.

The backup phrase, known as a seed, is a list of 12 english words. It allows you to recover full access to your funds if needed.

Only you alone possess this seed. Keep it private.

Do not share this seed with anyone.
Beware of phishing. The developers of Phoenix will never ask for your seed.

Do not lose this seed.
Save it somewhere safe (not on this phone). If you lose your seed and your phone, you've lost your funds.
BIP39 seed with standard BIP84 derivation path
I have made a backup of my seed, for example on a piece of paper.
KEEP THIS SEED SAFE.\nDO NOT SHARE.
Here you can extract and share the application logs.
There was an error when retrieving the details for this payment:\n\nCause:%1$s
Failed. No money has been sent.
Payment has not been received yet.
You can attach a note to this payment.
This fee covers the cost of opening a new payment channel.

This payment happened following a conflict in a channel. Funds will be sent to your on-chain address: %1$s.

To recover your funds, follow the FAQ instructions.
Add a custom description to this payment
Recipient is not reachable, or does not have enough inbound liquidity.
Payment rejected by the recipient.\nThis usually occurs when the invoice has already been paid or when it contains an expiration date, and you attempted to send a payment after the expiration.
No route found with current fee setting. Try with higher fees.
We recommend enabling the screen lock to prevent unintended use of your wallet.
Your device does not support hardware backed user authentication.
Your biometric hardware is not available.
Please enroll a PIN/Schema/Fingerprint in Android first.
An Android security update is required.
Not supported by your version of Android.
Too many attempts, try again later.
Lock access to the app with Android\'s screen lock/fingerprint
Enroll a fingerprint in Android for additional security features.
Confirm that you\'ve backed up your recovery phrase for additional security features.
App requires manual user unlock to run. Background payment reception is therefore not possible.\n\nOnly fingerprint authentication is supported.
Background features will be disabled. To receive payments the app will have to be unlocked.

You can use your wallet to anonymously sign and authorize an action on:

%1$s

No personal data will be shared with this service.
Could not get a valid invoice from %1$s.\n\nYou may want to try again later.
Could not get a valid invoice from %1$s (code %2$s).\n\nYou may want to try again later.
There was an error when handling this invoice. Please try again later.
Please hold while %1$s is sending funds.\n\nKeep the app online.
Could not redeem the payment. Please try again.
This request to redeem payment is invalid. Please try again.
%1$s responded with an error: %2$s.\n\nTry again later, or contact their support.
Hiding balance helps against prying eyes
Phoenix needs to access the Bitcoin blockchain to monitor and secure your channels. This is done using public Electrum servers. You can also configure your own server.
%1$s provided an unknown certificate!\nTap to configure.
We are using the pinned public key %1$s
You can improve your privacy by only using Tor when connecting to an Electrum server or to your Lightning peer. This will slightly slow down the application startup.
Are you sure you want to disable Tor?
Are you sure you want to enable Tor? Note that for best result, it\'s recommended to start a new wallet as well.
You have connection issue(s). The app will not function correctly.
Your device has no Internet connection. The app will not function properly.\n\nPlease check your device\'s setting.
Phoenix is a Bitcoin wallet using the Lightning network for sending and receiving payments.\n\nIt is a free open source software, developed by ACINQ under the Apache 2.0 License.
This wallet is self-custodial: you have sole custody of the wallet\'s 12-words seed key.\n\nThis key gives access to your money. Do not reveal it to anyone, and beware of phishing.

Bitcoin/fiat exchange rates are retrieved from various third-party APIs:
- Blockchain.info
- powered by Coindesk.com

Those rates may not be accurate. Always check the actual Bitcoin amount before sending a payment.
Set various options regarding payments you send or receive.
Payment requests that you create will use this description. You can override it on a case-by-case basis.
Payment requests generated by your wallet are stale after this delay. Default value is 1 week.

It is sometimes necessary to create a new Lightning payment channel in order to receive an incoming payment.\n\nIn this case a fee of %1$s%% is deducted from the amount received, to cover the cost of creating the channel.
The app will automatically create a channel when needed to receive a payment.\n\nNote that a %1$s%% fee is deducted from the amount received, to cover the cost of creating the channel.
Maximum fee for outgoing Lightning payments
Override default fee for outgoing payments
Enter a base fee in satoshi
Enter a valid maximum fee setting
Base fee must be at least %1$s.
Proportional fee must be at least %1$s%%.
This fee applies when you receive a payment over Lightning and a new channel needs to be created.
See the FAQ for more information
You are now using the new Phoenix version. Your channels are being migrated and will be ready soon.
